The Fibonacci numbers are defined recursively by <math>F_{0}=0, F_{1}=1,</math> and <math>F_{n+2}=F_{n+1}+F_{n}</math> for all <math>n \geq 0</math> Use the method of advancement operators to find an explicit expression for <math>F_{n}</math>.

== Solution ==
* We have <math>F_{n + 2} = F_{n + 1} + F_{n} \Leftrightarrow F_{n + 2}  - F_{n + 1}  - F_{n} = 0 </math>  so then <math>\left( A^2  - A  - 1 \right) F_{n} = 0</math> from the quadratic equation one obtains:<math display="block">\left( A - \frac{1 + \sqrt{5} }{2}  \right) \left( A  - \frac{1 - \sqrt{5} }{2}  \right)F_{n} = 0 </math> and so the general form of our solution is <math>F_{n} = c_1\left( \frac{1 + \sqrt{5} }{2}  \right) ^{n}  + c_2 \left( \frac{1 - \sqrt{5} }{2}  \right) ^{n} </math>
* Since <math>F_{0} = 0</math>  we have <math>c1 =  - c2</math>  and then we require <math>F_{1} = 1</math>, for this to be true one requires that :<math display="block">F_{1} = c_1\left( \frac{1 + \sqrt{5} }{2}  \right)  - c_1\left( \frac{1  - \sqrt{5}}{2}   \right) = \frac{c_1\left( 1 + \sqrt{5}  + \sqrt{5}  - 1 \right) }{2} = c_1\sqrt{5} </math>  to be equal to 1
* So we have that <math>c_1= \frac{1}{\sqrt{5} } </math>, and so <math>c_2= -\frac{1}{\sqrt{5} } </math>  now we have the general form, namely <math display="block">F_{n} = \frac{\left( \frac{1 + \sqrt{5} }{2}  \right)  - \left(  \frac{1 - \sqrt{5} }{2}   \right) }{\sqrt{5} } </math>
